DataElement.preferredName: Health Care Provider Instruction Six Mercaptopurine Take With Food Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A single character text field to indicate if there was an instruction by a health care provider to take 6MP with food.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Health Care Provider Instruction Six Mercaptopurine Take With Food
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care._A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one._A message describing how something is to be done._A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)_As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._A group of materials of either plant, animal or artificial origin containing essential body nutrients that can be ingested by an organism to produce energy, stimulate growth, and maintain life.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities, or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Concepts.definition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Property.preferredName: Six Mercaptopurine Take With Food Instruction
Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.:A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04):As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:A group of substances which are consumed by humans and animals.:A message describing how something is to be done.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.

A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)
As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A group of materials of either plant, animal or artificial origin containing essential body nutrients that can be ingested by an organism to produce energy, stimulate growth, and maintain life.
A message describing how something is to be done.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to record data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
